repnme.cdata!:
Jordan - Third Economic Reform and
            Development Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability is highly likely, and
            institutional development impacts are high. The successful
            implementation of the project owes to several factors:
            facilitation, and the necessary impetus provided by the
            preceding operations, particularly their broad coverage, and
            programmatic structure; the useful mechanism of a
            single-tranche disbursement operation, which provides clear
            understanding on prior actions to be taken by the
            Government; and, the effective dialogue among counterparts
            at all stages of the program, as well as the support of
            strong Government commitment. However, in terms of outcome,
            the stagnant growth rate of the economy, hinders poverty
            alleviation, and remains a persistent concern. While the
            Government continues to meet the challenges of maintaining
            macroeconomic stability, the volatility of the economy
            increases commensurately, with the security situation in the
            region, translating into less-than-anticipated domestic, and
            foreign investments. Recommendations suggest: conducting an
            in-depth study on the growth constraints, and obstacles of
            the country's economy; undertaking the Bank's
            Business Environment Survey, to obtain the viewpoint for an
            enabling environment for the private sector; and, pursuing
            public sector reforms, focused on public investment
            programs, institutional arrangements for budgetary
            decision-making, and increasing productivity of investments.

docna.cdata!:
Jordan - Third Economic Reform and
            Development Loan Project

5083507.trustfund:
TF028227-IDF-JORDAN PRIVATIZATION TA PROPOSAL,TF034977-JORDAN - ECONOMIC REFORM AND
            DEVELOPMENT LOAN III,TF021518-SECONDMENT OF MR. SENGUPTA
5083507.majtheme: Rule of law,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Jordan - Third Economic Reform and
            Development Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
A key objective of the series of
            Economic Reform and Development Loans (ERDLs), of which this
            is the third, is to support Jordan in addressing constraints
            to rapid and sustained growth imposed by the limitations of
            a relatively small domestic market. The loan supports a set
            of trade, privatization, financial sector, and regulatory
            reforms. It further facilitates trade, fosters integration
            with world markets, and reduces administrative obstacles
            that raise the cost of trading activity through streamlining
            customs procedures for exports and the planned conversion of
            the entire Aqaba area into a fully developed free port. It
            supports a broad program of financial sector reform
            initiatives designed to enhance the soundness and efficiency
            of the banking system and promote the development of capital
            market and long-term savings institutions. It improves
            banking competition and supervision and increases the
            efficiency of financial intermediation through modernization
            of the institutional and legislative set-up. It encourages
            long-term savings and promotes development of new financial
            instruments and markets. It facilitates entry and improves
            incentives for domestic and foreign investors. Through
            privatization, it improves opportunities for private sector
            firms, increases competition, and allows the Government to
            concentrate on its core functions. The loan will be
            disbursed in one tranche.
